intro: Lychnophora unicaulis, commonly known as the single-stemmed lychnophora, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a single, upright stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellowish flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the dry season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
